vision.notes: Ray-finned fishes; vision is likely the primary sense for prey detection and navigation in aquatic environments. Assumed to be similar to other ray-finned fishes unless specified otherwise.

mechanoreception.notes: Fish possess a lateral line system for detecting vibrations and pressure changes in the water. This is crucial for spatial awareness, predator avoidance, and potentially communication. Common in ray-finned fishes.

chemoreception.notes: Fish rely on both taste and smell to locate food, assess water quality, and potentially recognize individuals. Given the freshwater and brackish habitats of many species, chemoreception is likely well-developed.
